Maroc - Pret d'Investissement dans
            le Secteur de la Sante (PRISS)

trustfund:
TF028065-CANADIAN CONSLT. COOP. PROGRAM,TF020250-FRENCH CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF020090-BELGIAN CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF035774-MOROCCO - BASIC HEALTH PROJECTS,TF034762-MOROCCO - HEALTH SECTOR
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall assessment of the project is
            unsatisfactory. Project objectives aimed at reinforcing
            basic health services, and, strengthening emergency and
            referral services, were not fully implemented. However,
            activities such as health financing, and, management
            autonomy for larger number of hospitals, though achieved
            only towards the end of the project, predict a positive
            long-term impact on sector development. Regardless of the
            negative outcome, the project did play an important role as
            a catalyst in the overall sector development, and
            contributed to launching sector reforms. The lessons learned
            show that a gradual approach is key to the reform process,
            and successful realistic projects, attain limited numbers of
            priority activities. The provision of adequate support to
            priority public health programs is essential, allowing
            governments to allocate further public resources to these
            programs. The integration of investment projects within a
            well structured development strategy, allows clear targets
            to achieve essential health services. It is also emphasized,
            that the involvement of stakeholders, in project
            implementation, further ensures consensus, and coordination
            on health financing strategies. Finally, it is suggested
            that monitoring and evaluation indicators, at an early
            start, are relevant, as is the continuity of Bank's supervision.
